word: I am worn out with anxiety and this journey has nearly killed me. My ambition is gone; my strength is gone, but this will not last if we can have a fair chance. I hope that by the cheering light of the countenance of my Saviour, I shall have the springback power.--Letter 20, 1879, p. 2. (To Mrs. W. C. White, May 20, 1879.)
